trans-unit.source: How to use the SendGrid email service (.NET) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use the SendGrid email service (.NET) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in C# and use the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in C# and use the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: Last Update: Feburary 24, 2015
trans-unit.target: Last Update: Feburary 24, 2015

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in C\# and use the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in C\# and use the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, adding attachments, and using filters.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, adding attachments, and using filters.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.

trans-unit.source: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:
trans-unit.target: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:

trans-unit.source: Automatically sending receipts to customers.
trans-unit.target: Automatically sending receipts to customers.

trans-unit.source: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers.
trans-unit.target: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers.

trans-unit.source: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked email, and customer responsiveness.
trans-unit.target: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked email, and customer responsiveness.

trans-unit.source: Generating reports to help identify trends.
trans-unit.target: Generating reports to help identify trends.

trans-unit.source: Forwarding customer inquiries.
trans-unit.target: Forwarding customer inquiries.

trans-unit.source: Processing incoming emails.
trans-unit.target: Processing incoming emails.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText><title></title> is the easiest way to get the SendGrid API and to configure your application with all dependencies.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText><title></title> is the easiest way to get the SendGrid API and to configure your application with all dependencies.

trans-unit.source: NuGet is a Visual Studio extension included with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 that makes it easy to install and update libraries and tools.
trans-unit.target: NuGet is a Visual Studio extension included with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 that makes it easy to install and update libraries and tools.

trans-unit.source: To install NuGet if you are running a version of Visual Studio earlier than Visual Studio 2012, visit http://www.nuget.org, and click the Install NuGet button.
trans-unit.target: To install NuGet if you are running a version of Visual Studio earlier than Visual Studio 2012, visit http://www.nuget.org, and click the Install NuGet button.

trans-unit.source: To install the SendGrid NuGet package in your application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To install the SendGrid NuGet package in your application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click References, then click Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click References, then click Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: In the left-hand pane of the Manage NuGet Packages dialog, click Online.
trans-unit.target: In the left-hand pane of the Manage NuGet Packages dialog, click Online.

trans-unit.source: Search for SendGrid and select the SendGrid item in the results list (the current version is 5.0.0).
trans-unit.target: Search for SendGrid and select the SendGrid item in the results list (the current version is 5.0.0).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Install to complete the installation, and then close this dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click Install to complete the installation, and then close this dialog.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid's .NET class library is called SendGridMail.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid's .NET class library is called SendGridMail.

trans-unit.source: It contains the following namespaces:
trans-unit.target: It contains the following namespaces:

trans-unit.source: SendGridMail for creating and working with email items.
trans-unit.target: SendGridMail for creating and working with email items.

trans-unit.source: SendGridMail.Transport for sending email using either the SMTP protocol, or the HTTP 1.1 protocol with Web/REST.
trans-unit.target: SendGridMail.Transport for sending email using either the SMTP protocol, or the HTTP 1.1 protocol with Web/REST.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code namespace declarations to the top of any C\# file in which you want to programmatically access the SendGrid email service.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code namespace declarations to the top of any C\# file in which you want to programmatically access the SendGrid email service.

trans-unit.source: System.Net and System.Net.Mail are .NET Framework namespaces that are included because they include types you will commonly use with the SendGrid APIs.
trans-unit.target: System.Net and System.Net.Mail are .NET Framework namespaces that are included because they include types you will commonly use with the SendGrid APIs.

trans-unit.source: Use the SendGridMessage object to create an email message.
trans-unit.target: Use the SendGridMessage object to create an email message.

trans-unit.source: Once the message object is created, you can set properties and methods, including the email sender, the email recipient, and the subject and body of the email.
trans-unit.target: Once the message object is created, you can set properties and methods, including the email sender, the email recipient, and the subject and body of the email.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how to create a fully populated email object:
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how to create a fully populated email object:

trans-unit.source: For more information on all properties and methods supported by the SendGrid type, see sendgrid-csharp on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: For more information on all properties and methods supported by the SendGrid type, see sendgrid-csharp on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: After creating an email message, you can send it using the Web API provided by SendGrid.
trans-unit.target: After creating an email message, you can send it using the Web API provided by SendGrid.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you may <linkText>use .NET's built in library</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you may <linkText>use .NET's built in library</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Sending email requires that you supply your SendGrid account credentials (username and password).
trans-unit.target: Sending email requires that you supply your SendGrid account credentials (username and password).

trans-unit.source: The following code demonstrates how to wrap your credentials in a NetworkCredential object:
trans-unit.target: The following code demonstrates how to wrap your credentials in a NetworkCredential object:

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to send a message using the Web API.
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to send a message using the Web API.

trans-unit.source: Attachments can be added to a message by calling the AddAttachment method and specifying the name and path of the file you want to attach.
trans-unit.target: Attachments can be added to a message by calling the AddAttachment method and specifying the name and path of the file you want to attach.

trans-unit.source: You can include multiple attachments by calling this method once for each file you wish to attach.
trans-unit.target: You can include multiple attachments by calling this method once for each file you wish to attach.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates adding an attachment to a message:
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates adding an attachment to a message:

trans-unit.source: You can also add attachments from the data's Stream.
trans-unit.target: You can also add attachments from the data's Stream.

trans-unit.source: It can be done by calling the same method as above, AddAttachment, but by passing in the Stream of the data, and the filename you want it to show as in the message.
trans-unit.target: It can be done by calling the same method as above, AddAttachment, but by passing in the Stream of the data, and the filename you want it to show as in the message.

trans-unit.source: In this case you will need to add the System.IO library.
trans-unit.target: In this case you will need to add the System.IO library.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of apps.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of apps.

trans-unit.source: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.
trans-unit.target: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of apps, see <linkText>App Settings</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of apps, see <linkText>App Settings</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Apps can be applied to SendGrid email messages using methods implemented as part of the SendGrid class.
trans-unit.target: Apps can be applied to SendGrid email messages using methods implemented as part of the SendGrid class.

trans-unit.source: The following examples demonstrate the footer and click tracking filters:
trans-unit.target: The following examples demonstrate the footer and click tracking filters:

trans-unit.source: SendGrid offers web-based APIs and webhooks that you can use to leverage additional SendGrid functionality from your Azure application.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid offers web-based APIs and webhooks that you can use to leverage additional SendGrid functionality from your Azure application.

trans-unit.source: For full details, see the <linkText>SendGrid API documentation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For full details, see the <linkText>SendGrid API documentation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that you've learned the basics of the SendGrid Email service, follow these links to learn more.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned the basics of the SendGrid Email service, follow these links to learn more.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid C\# library repo: <linkText>sendgrid-csharp</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: SendGrid C\# library repo: <linkText>sendgrid-csharp</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: SendGrid API documentation: <https://sendgrid.com/docs>
trans-unit.target: SendGrid API documentation: <https://sendgrid.com/docs>

trans-unit.source: SendGrid special offer for Azure customers: <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: SendGrid special offer for Azure customers: <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>
